report.title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea
report.author: Thunnus
report.bodytext: I have rather obstructive sleep apnea. Combined with years of insomnia that never went away after a bad bout with depression, I used to only get about 3-4 hours of sleep each night. This was due to a few different factors: /n /n 1. My insomnia prevented me from getting to bed until the wee hours of the morning. /n /n 2. My apnea-treatment is very uncomfortable. I usually only get 3-4 hours of uninterrupted sleep before I wake up and in the past, I usually was not able to get back to sleep. /n /n 3. Even the 3-4 hours I was getting was not very restful. /n /n Since starting treatment with cannabis, I am able to: /n /n 1. Sleep more or less when I want to /n 2. Sometimes get 6-7 hours of uninterrupted sleep /n 3. Even if I wake up after 3-4 hours, I can get back to sleep /n 4. Each sleep cycle is more restful. /n /n I live in a legal state but I really hope it becomes federally legal for med use. Its a shame because there are really no side-effects, it is not addictive and there is no hangover. What more could I ask for from a sleep therapy med - all the others come with a host of side-effects and most synthesized med are, in varying degress, toxic to the body.
